H0.text: Soil is the primary source of energy in food webs.

H1.text: Sunlight is the primary source of energy in food webs.

H2.text: Producer is the primary source of energy in food webs.

H3.text: Consumer is the primary source of energy in food webs.

A4.text: Producers are important because they convert energy from the sun into a storable and usable chemical form of energy, glucose, as well as oxygen.

A5.text: The glucose stored within producers serves as food for consumers, and so it is only through producers that consumers are able to access the sun's energy.
